abstract.p: Shares of Freeserve, Britain's largest Internet provider, pummel after company confirms that talks to be acquired by Deutsche Telekom's Internet arm, T-Online, have collapsed and that takeover of company in near future is unlikely (S)

block.p: Shares of Britain's largest Internet service provider, Freeserve, were pummeled after the company confirmed that talks to be acquired by Deutsche Telekom's Internet arm, T-Online, had collapsed and that a takeover of the company in the near future was unlikely. Freeserve's stock fell 17 percent, to 365 pence, or about $5.48. Shares of Freeserve's parent, the Dixons Group, a British electronics retailer, which owns 80 percent of the company, fell 7 percent, to 263.5 pence. Freeserve also said it lost $:5.8 million, or about $8.7 million, in its fourth quarter. The results met analysts' expections.

Shares of Britain's largest Internet service provider, Freeserve, were pummeled after the company confirmed that talks to be acquired by Deutsche Telekom's Internet arm, T-Online, had collapsed and that a takeover of the company in the near future was unlikely. Freeserve's stock fell 17 percent, to 365 pence, or about $5.48. Shares of Freeserve's parent, the Dixons Group, a British electronics retailer, which owns 80 percent of the company, fell 7 percent, to 263.5 pence. Freeserve also said it lost $:5.8 million, or about $8.7 million, in its fourth quarter. The results met analysts' expections.
